Package ohos.media.camera.device

Interface FrameConfig.Builder

  • Enclosing interface:
    FrameConfig

    public static interface FrameConfig.Builder
    Provides frame configuration Builder objects.

    A created Builder object cannot be changed.

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • addSurface

        FrameConfig.Builder addSurface​(Surface surface)
        Adds a surface as frame capture output.

        The output surface to be added must have been added by calling CameraConfig.Builder#addSurface(Surface), and the camera have been successfully configured with CameraConfig. Otherwise, frame capture methods defined in Camera may throw parameter exceptions.

        Parameters:
        surface - Indicates an output surface to be added.
        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1

      • removeSurface

        FrameConfig.Builder removeSurface​(Surface surface)
        Removes an output surface.
        Parameters:
        surface - Indicates a surface added as frame capture output.
        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1

      • setFaceDetection

        FrameConfig.Builder setFaceDetection​(int type,
                                     boolean isEnable)
        Sets face detection and returns the result through a callback.

        Only a supported type of face detection can be set using this method. The supported face detection types can be obtained by calling CameraAbility#getSupportedFaceDetection().

        The face detection result can be obtained by FrameResult#getFaceDetectionResult().

        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the face detection type.

        The face detection type to set must be one or more supported types. Both Metadata.FaceDetectionType.FACE_DETECTION and Metadata.FaceDetectionType.FACE_SMILE_DETECTION can be enabled simultaneously by calling setFaceDetection(FaceDetectionType.FACE_DETECTION | FaceDetectionType.FACE_SMILE_DETECTION, true). An invalid detection type will be ignored.

        isEnable - Indicates whether face detection is enabled. true means detection is enabled, while false means it is disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Metadata.FaceDetectionType

      • setAfMode

        FrameConfig.Builder setAfMode​(int afMode,
                              Rect rect)
        Sets the AF mode.

        Only a supported AF mode can be set using this method. The supported AF modes can be obtained by CameraAbility#getSupportedAfMode().

        The AF result can be obtained by FrameResult#getAfResult().

        Parameters:
        afMode - Indicates the AF mode to set. An invalid AF mode will be ignored.
        rect - Indicates a rectangular area for AF.

        If the input value is null, the area is the same as the preview area. The central coordinate system is adopted, which ranges from (-1000, -1000) to (1000, 1000), to describe the AF area. The value range and direction are consistent with those of the preview area, regardless of zooming, rotation direction, and other factors alike.

        If the rectangle AF area exceeds the valid range, the AF mode will not take effect.

        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Metadata.AfMode

      • setAfTrigger

        FrameConfig.Builder setAfTrigger​(int afTrigger)
        Triggers an AF.

        Only supported types of AF triggers can be set using this method.

        The AF result can be obtained by FrameResult#getAfResult().

        Parameters:
        afTrigger - Indicates the AF trigger type to set. An invalid trigger type will be ignored.
        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Metadata.AfTrigger

      • setAeMode

        FrameConfig.Builder setAeMode​(int aeMode,
                              Rect rect)
        Sets the AE mode.

        Only a supported AE mode can be set using this method. The supported AE modes can be obtained by CameraAbility#getSupportedAeMode().

        The AE result can be obtained by FrameResult#getAeResult().

        Parameters:
        aeMode - Indicates the AE mode to set. An invalid AE mode will be ignored.
        rect - Indicates the rectangle area for AE.

        If the input value is null, the area is the same as the preview area. The central coordinate system is adopted, which ranges from (-1000, -1000) to (1000, 1000), to describe the AE area. The value range and direction are consistent with those of the preview area, regardless of zooming, rotation direction, and other factors alike.

        If the rectangle AE area exceeds the valid range, the AE mode will not take effect.

        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Metadata.AeMode

        See Also:

      • setAwbMode

        FrameConfig.Builder setAwbMode​(int awbMode,
                               Rect rect)
        Sets the auto white balance (AWB) mode.

        You can call this method to set only the supported AWB modes got via CameraAbility#getSupportedAwbMode().

        Parameters:
        awbMode - Indicates the AWB mode to set. An invalid AWB mode will be ignored.
        rect - Indicates the rectangle area for AWB.

        If the input value is null, the area is the same as the preview area. The central coordinate system is adopted, which ranges from (-1000, -1000) to (1000, 1000), to describe the AWB area. The value range and direction are consistent with those of the preview area, regardless of zooming, rotation direction, and other factors alike.

        If the AWB area exceeds the valid range, the AWB mode will not take effect.

        Returns:
        Returns the Builder object.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        Metadata.AwbMode

      • setZoom

        FrameConfig.Builder setZoom​(float value)
        Sets a zoom value.

        Only a zoom value within the supported range can be set using this method. The supported zoom value range can be obtained by calling CameraAbility#getSupportedZoom().

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the zoom value to set.

        The value must be within the supported range. An invalid zoom value will be ignored.

        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1

      • setFlashMode

        FrameConfig.Builder setFlashMode​(int flashMode)
        Sets the flash mode.

        Only supported flash mode can be set using this method. The supported flash modes can be obtained by calling CameraAbility#getSupportedFlashMode().

        Parameters:
        flashMode - Indicates the flash mode to set. An invalid flash mode will be ignored.
        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Metadata.FlashMode

      • setMark

        FrameConfig.Builder setMark​(Object mark)
        Sets the unique mark on a FrameConfig instance.

        The mark is used to identify a FrameConfig instance during frame processing by the camera.

        Parameters:
        mark - Indicates the unique FrameConfig mark.
        Returns:
        Returns the Builder object.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        FrameStateCallback.onFrameStarted(Camera, FrameConfig, long, long), FrameStateCallback.onFrameProgressed(Camera, FrameConfig, FrameResult), FrameStateCallback.onFrameFinished(Camera, FrameConfig, FrameResult), FrameStateCallback.onFrameError(Camera, FrameConfig, int, FrameResult), FrameConfig.getMark()

      • setLocation

        FrameConfig.Builder setLocation​(Location location)
        Sets geolocation information.
        Parameters:
        location - Indicates the geolocation information to set. The value can be null, which means that a saved image does not have geolocation information.
        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1

      • setImageRotation

        FrameConfig.Builder setImageRotation​(int degrees)
        Sets an image rotation angle to correct the image rotation information at the HAL layer.

        This method is used to update the rotation angle of an image (or a frame in JPEG format) whenever it is captured.

        Parameters:
        degrees - Indicates degrees of the rotation angle.

        The value should be a multiple of 90, such as 0, 90, 180, and 270. Other integers will be rounded to multiples of 90.

        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1

      • setParameter

        <T> FrameConfig.Builder setParameter​(ParameterKey.Key<T> key,
                                     T value)
        Sets a camera parameter.

        Only a supported parameter can be set using this method. Supported camera parameters can be obtained by calling CameraAbility#getSupportedParameters(). The parameter value range can be obtained by CameraAbility#getParameterRange(ParameterKey.Key).

        The results related to the parameter settings can be obtained by FrameResult#getParametersResult().

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates the data type of a camera parameter.
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates a camera parameter to set.
        value - Indicates a parameter value.

        The value must be within the value range. An invalid value is ignored.

        Returns:
        Returns a Builder object.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        CameraAbility.getSupportedParameters(), CameraAbility.getParameterRange(ParameterKey.Key)

        Returns:

        Since:
        3

      • getSurfaces

        List<Surface> getSurfaces​()
        Gets all surfaces configured for the current frame capture.
        Returns:
        Returns all surfaces configured; returns a list with the length of 0 if no surface is configured.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        addSurface(Surface)

      • setCoordinateSurface

        FrameConfig.Builder setCoordinateSurface​(Surface surface)
        Sets the surface holding the central coordinate system.

        Origin coordinates of the central camera coordinate system are calculated based on the surface. The surface must have been added to the FrameConfig instance by the addSurface(ohos.agp.graphics.Surface) method. If no surface has been set by setCoordinateSurface(Surface), the first surface added by the addSurface(ohos.agp.graphics.Surface) method is used as the basis of the central coordinate system.

        Parameters:
        surface - Indicates the surface to be used as the basis of the central coordinate system.
        Returns:
        Returns the Builder object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if surface is null.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if surface does not exist in the FrameConfig instance.
        Since:
        3

      • getAfMode

        int getAfMode​()
        Gets the autofocus (AF) mode configured for the current frame capture.
        Returns:
        Returns the configured AF mode.
        Since:

      • build
